excerpt: A delicious vegan take on the traditional deep-fried falafel balls.
instructions: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt. Pulse until combined but still slightly chunky.
Add the flour and pulse again until everything is combined.
Form the mixture into small balls, about 2 tablespoons of mixture per ball. Dust each ball with flour.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add enough oil to coat the bottom of the skillet.
Place the falafel balls in the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce or in a pita with veggies and hummus.
